title: syntex_errors-0.59.1 build fails with --target=wasm32-unknown-unknown
body:
I was trying to build a crate which includes `syntex_errors-0.59.1` as a dependency with `rustc 1.25.0-nightly (58a8e0c27 2018-02-16)` for `wasm32-unknown-unknown` target and it failed:
```
$ cargo build --target=wasm32-unknown-unknown --release
    Updating registry `https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index`
   Compiling itoa v0.3.4                                                        
   Compiling quote v0.3.15
   Compiling bitflags v0.9.1
   Compiling num-traits v0.2.0
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.1.0
   Compiling semver-parser v0.7.0
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.0.4
   Compiling term v0.4.6
   Compiling libc v0.2.36
   Compiling rand v0.4.2
   Compiling cfg-if v0.1.2
   Compiling dtoa v0.4.2
   Compiling synom v0.11.3
   Compiling num-traits v0.1.43
   Compiling log v0.4.1
   Compiling semver v0.6.0
   Compiling syn v0.11.11
   Compiling log v0.3.9
   Compiling rustc_version v0.2.1
   Compiling extprim v1.5.1
   Compiling serde_derive_internals v0.19.0
   Compiling serde_derive v1.0.27
   Compiling serde v1.0.27
   Compiling serde_json v1.0.9
   Compiling syntex_pos v0.59.1
   Compiling syntex_errors v0.59.1
error[E0425]: cannot find function `stderr_isatty` in this scope
  --> /home/user/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/syntex_errors-0.59.1/src/emitter.rs:95:34
   |
95 |             ColorConfig::Auto => stderr_isatty(),
   |                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ not found in this scope

error[E0425]: cannot find function `acquire_global_lock` in module `lock`
    --> /home/user/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/syntex_errors-0.59.1/src/emitter.rs:1242:30
     |
1242 |     let _buffer_lock = lock::acquire_global_lock("rustc_errors");
     |                              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ not found in `lock`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

error: Could not compile `syntex_errors`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

It builds just fine for native target (`x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu`), so I assume it's a webassembly issue.
